New Records: Spencer Dinwiddie scored a season-high 30 points for the Dallas Mavericks.
P.J. Washington scored a season-high 28 points for the Dallas Mavericks.
The Dallas Mavericks had a 14-point lead in the fourth quarter, a team record.
Key Match Events: The Sacramento Kings had a 17-2 run in the third quarter to take control of the game.
Fouls and free throws were critical late in the game as the Kings extended their lead.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dallas Mavericks were short-handed with four starters missing, including Luka Doncic, Kyrie Irving, and Klay Thompson.
The Sacramento Kings were reeling after firing their head coach on Friday.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks struggled without their key players and had a tough time keeping up with the Kings' offensive rebounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Both teams had significant foul counts, with multiple players fouling out.
The Kings had 18 offensive rebounds, a key factor in their win.
Others: The Mavericks shot 42.1% from the floor and 24% of their points from the free-throw line.
The Kings' ability to exploit the Mavericks' poor shooting was a major factor.
